meanings.definition: Having difficulty reading or interpreting words due to a learning disability.
meanings.sent1: The dyslectic student struggled with reading the simple story.
meanings.sent2: She is dyslectic, so she finds it hard to read quickly.
meanings.sent3: The dyslectic comedian joked about mixing up letters in words.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt dyslectic, like a jumbled puzzle of letters.
meanings.sent5: The dyslectic nature of the font made it impossible for her to decipher the text.

meanings.sent1: The dyslectic in our class uses special tools to help with reading.
meanings.sent2: As a dyslectic, he often listens to audiobooks instead of reading.
meanings.sent3: The dyslectic at the library always asks for help finding books.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a dyslectic puzzle piece in a world of straight edges.
meanings.sent5: The dyslectic's determination to learn inspires those around them.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to or characteristic of dyslexia.
meanings.sent1: The dyslectic font was designed to aid those with reading difficulties.
meanings.sent2: Her dyslectic struggles motivated her to seek help from a tutor.
meanings.sent3: The dyslectic patterns on the wallpaper seemed to move and shift.
meanings.sent4: The dyslectic nature of the language made it challenging for beginners.
meanings.sent5: The dyslectic nature of the test made it a daunting challenge for students.
